intro: Mappia montana, commonly known as the mountain mappia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
